resources.string: Core Values List and Definitions
representing one’s true nature or beliefs; true to oneself or to the person identified
something accomplished, especially by superior ability, special effort, great courage, etc.; a great or heroic deed
participation in exciting undertakings or enterprises
the power to determine, adjudicate, or otherwise settle issues or disputes; jurisdiction; the right to control, command, or determine
independence or freedom, as of the will or one\'s actions
mental steadiness or emotional stability; habit of calm behavior, judgment, etc.
the quality present in a thing or person that gives intense pleasure or deep satisfaction to the mind, a meaningful design or pattern, or something else
not hesitating or fearful in the face of actual or possible danger or rebuff; courageous and daring
a feeling of deep sympathy and sorrow for another who is stricken by misfortune, accompanied by a strong desire to alleviate the suffering
something that by its nature or character serves as a call to battle, contest, special effort, etc.
the character of an individual viewed as a member of society; behavior in terms of the duties, obligations, and functions of a citizen

a social, religious, occupational, or other group sharing common characteristics or interests and perceived or perceiving itself as distinct in some respect from the larger society within which it exists
the quality of being competent; adequacy; possession of required skill, knowledge, qualification, or capacity
to be an important factor in; help to cause

the ability to transcend traditional ideas, rules, patterns, relationships, or the like, and to create meaningful new ideas, forms, methods, interpretations, etc.; originality, progressiveness, or imagination
the desire to learn or know about anything; inquisitiveness
the quality of being resolute; firmness of purpose
the state, condition, or quality of being fair, or free from bias or injustice; evenhandedness
belief in God or in the doctrines or teachings of religion
widespread reputation, especially of a favorable character; renown; public eminence
attachment to another by feelings of affection or personal regard
enjoyment or playfulness
the act or process, or a manner of growing; development; gradual increase
good fortune; pleasure; contentment; joy
truthfulness, sincerity, or frankness
expressing or perceiving the amusing or comical
the capacity or power of persons or things to be a compelling force on or produce effects on the actions, behavior, opinions, etc., of others
a consistent, orderly, or pleasing arrangement of thoughts, feelings, and emotions
the quality of being just; righteousness, equitableness, or moral rightness
of a good or benevolent nature or disposition, as a person
acquaintance with facts, truths, or principles, as from study or investigation; general erudition
the position or function of a leader, a person who guides or directs a group
knowledge acquired by systematic study in any field of scholarly application
a feeling of warm personal attachment or deep affection, as for a parent, child, or friend
faithfulness to commitments or obligations
the end, purpose, or significance of effort directed to produce or accomplish something
accessible to appeals, ideas, or offers
a disposition or tendency to look on the more favorable side of events or conditions and to expect the most favorable outcome
a state of mutual harmony between people or groups, especially in personal relations
enjoyment or satisfaction derived from what is to one\'s liking; gratification; delight
a dignified, self-confident manner or bearing; composure; self-possession
the favor of the general public or of a particular group of people
appreciation of (achievement, service, merit, etc.), as by some reward, public honor, or the like

a set of beliefs concerning the cause, nature, and purpose of the universe, especially when considered as the creation of a superhuman agency or agencies, usually involving devotional and ritual observances, and often containing a moral code governing the conduct of human affairs
a favorable and publicly recognized name or standing for merit, achievement, reliability, etc.
esteem for or a sense of the worth or excellence of a person, a personal quality or ability, or something considered as a manifestation of a personal quality or ability
the state or fact of being responsible, answerable, or accountable for something within one's power, control, or management
freedom from danger, risk, etc.; safety
proper esteem or regard for the dignity of one\'s character
something made or done for the public benefit and without regard to direct profit
relating to sacred things or matters; religious; devotional; sacred
steadfastness; constancy, as of character or purpose
the favorable or prosperous termination of attempts or endeavors; the accomplishment of one\'s goals
the position of an individual in relation to another or others, especially in regard to social or professional standing
deserving of trust or confidence; dependable; reliable
a great quantity or store of money, valuable possessions, property, or other riches
the quality or state of being wise; knowledge of what is true or right coupled with just judgment as to action; sagacity, discernment, or insight
